content.rendered:
Dear Diary,
Happy Sunday. I’ve had my shower and there is time for a walk before church. Fortunately, for me I’m driving to church and don’t have to walk to get there. If I did, I would probably be late.

I’m ready for cooler weather. Yet, it’s still only July and there are at least another five weeks of just too hot before it starts to cool off.

It’s National Hamburger Day and my ground beef is thawed from being in the freezer. I should celebrate after church. I think I’ll call it lunch. It’s also National Milk Chocolate Day. I have some chocolates that I can use to celebrate that, too. Yum. Today is National Waterpark Day, but I would rather celebrate National Air-conditioner Day.

It’s bright enough to go for a walk.

Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven. — Matthew 5:3 (KJV)

God,
You are holy, God.

Thank you for Today. Thank you for giving me a new day to love you and to love others as myself.

Thank you for giving me enough that I can share what I have with others. You lack nothing and you are kind enough to share what you have with me. God, You alone are good, kind and loving. Thank You for loving me so that I can love others.

Help me to hear what You would have me to hear at church.

Forgive me when I fail.
In Jesus’ name,
Amen
